N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 ยง 163.2 - Estimation of tax due

State Regulations
(a) A
nonresident taxpayer must estimate the personal income tax due on a form
prescribed by the commissioner, using an estimated tax rate that equals the
highest rate of tax for the taxable year provided in section
601
of the Tax Law. The estimated tax due will equal the gain, if any, multiplied
by that rate. The amount of the gain used in the computation is equal to the
amount reportable for Federal income tax purposes for the taxable
year. (b) If the real property
being sold or transferred is located partly within and partly without New York

State, then the nonresident taxpayer must estimate the tax due using only the
portion of the gain reasonably attributable to the portion of the real property
located within New York State. (c) If the nonresident taxpayer is an estate or trust, it must estimate the tax due
based on the gain, if any, computed without reduction for any distribution of
income to the beneficiaries during the tax year of the sale or
transfer. Notes
